Allows to copy documents from one index to another, optionally filtering the source
documents by a query, changing the destination index settings, or fetching the
documents from a remote cluster.

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description: If `true`, the request refreshes affected shards to make this operation visible to search.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Period each indexing waits for automatic index creation, dynamic mapping updates, and waiting for active shards.

parameters.name: wait_for_active_shards
parameters.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

parameters.name: wait_for_completion
parameters.description: If `true`, the request blocks until the operation is complete.

parameters.name: requests_per_second
parameters.description:
The throttle for this request in sub-requests per second.
Defaults to no throttle.

parameters.name: scroll
parameters.description: Specifies how long a consistent view of the index should be maintained for scrolled search.

parameters.name: slices
parameters.description:
The number of slices this task should be divided into.
Defaults to 1 slice, meaning the task isnâ€™t sliced into subtasks.

parameters.name: max_docs
parameters.description: Maximum number of documents to process (default: all documents).

get.description: Returns number of documents matching a query.

post.description: Returns number of documents matching a query.

Creates a new document in the index.

Returns a 409 response when a document with a same ID already exists in the index.

put.description:
Creates a new document in the index.

Returns a 409 response when a document with a same ID already exists in the index.

post.description: Deletes documents matching the provided query.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams or indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

parameters.name: analyzer
parameters.description: Analyzer to use for the query string.

parameters.name: analyze_wildcard
parameters.description: If `true`, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.

parameters.name: default_operator
parameters.description: The default operator for query string query: `AND` or `OR`.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Starting offset (default: 0)

parameters.name: ignore_unavailable
parameters.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

parameters.name: allow_no_indices
parameters.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

parameters.name: conflicts
parameters.description: What to do if delete by query hits version conflicts: `abort` or `proceed`.

parameters.name: expand_wildcards
parameters.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`. Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

parameters.name: lenient
parameters.description: If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.

parameters.name: preference
parameters.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Query in the Lucene query string syntax.

parameters.name: routing
parameters.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

parameters.name: scroll
parameters.description: Period to retain the search context for scrolling.

parameters.name: search_type
parameters.description:
The type of the search operation.
Available options: `query_then_fetch`, `dfs_query_then_fetch`.

parameters.name: search_timeout
parameters.description:
Explicit timeout for each search request.
Defaults to no timeout.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Deprecated, please use `max_docs` instead.

schema.description: Deprecated, please use `max_docs` instead.

parameters.name: max_docs
parameters.description:
Maximum number of documents to process.
Defaults to all documents.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of <field>:<direction> pairs.

parameters.name: _source
parameters.description: True or false to return the _source field or not, or a list of fields to return.

schema.description: True or false to return the _source field or not, or a list of fields to return.

parameters.name: _source_excludes
parameters.description: List of fields to exclude from the returned _source field.

schema.description: List of fields to exclude from the returned _source field.

parameters.name: _source_includes
parameters.description: List of fields to extract and return from the _source field.

schema.description: List of fields to extract and return from the _source field.

parameters.name: terminate_after
parameters.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Opensearch terminates the query early.
Opensearch collects documents before sorting.
Use with caution.
Opensearch applies this parameter to each shard handling the request.
When possible, let Opensearch perform early termination automatically.
Avoid specifying this parameter for requests that target data streams with backing indices across multiple data tiers.

parameters.name: stats
parameters.description: Specific `tag` of the request for logging and statistical purposes.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: If `true`, returns the document version as part of a hit.

parameters.name: request_cache
parameters.description:
If `true`, the request cache is used for this request.
Defaults to the index-level setting.

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description: If `true`, Opensearch refreshes all shards involved in the delete by query after the request completes.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Period each deletion request waits for active shards.

parameters.name: wait_for_active_shards
parameters.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to all or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

parameters.name: scroll_size
parameters.description: Size of the scroll request that powers the operation.

parameters.name: wait_for_completion
parameters.description: If `true`, the request blocks until the operation is complete.

parameters.name: requests_per_second
parameters.description: The throttle for this request in sub-requests per second.

parameters.name: slices
parameters.description: The number of slices this task should be divided into.

post.description: Creates or updates a document in an index.

delete.description: Removes a document from the index.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the document.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Name of the target index.

parameters.name: wait_for_active_shards
parameters.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description:
If `true`, Opensearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` do nothing with refreshes.
Valid values: `true`, `false`, `wait_for`.

parameters.name: routing
parameters.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Period to wait for active shards.

parameters.name: if_seq_no
parameters.description: Only perform the operation if the document has this sequence number.

parameters.name: if_primary_term
parameters.description: Only perform the operation if the document has this primary term.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description:
Explicit version number for concurrency control.
The specified version must match the current version of the document for the request to succeed.

parameters.name: version_type
parameters.description: Specific version type: `external`, `external_gte`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Document ID

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The name of the index

parameters.name: wait_for_active_shards
parameters.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operations.
Set to 'all' or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index
(number_of_replicas+1). Defaults to 1 meaning the primary shard.

parameters.name: _source
parameters.description:
Set to false to disable source retrieval. You can also specify a comma-separated
list of the fields you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: _source_excludes
parameters.description: Specify the source fields you want to exclude.

parameters.name: _source_includes
parameters.description: Specify the source fields you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: The script language.

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description:
If 'true', Opensearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation
visible to search, if 'wait_for' then wait for a refresh to make this operation
visible to search, if 'false' do nothing with refreshes.

parameters.name: retry_on_conflict
parameters.description: Specify how many times should the operation be retried when a conflict occurs.

parameters.name: routing
parameters.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Period to wait for dynamic mapping updates and active shards.
This guarantees Opensearch waits for at least the timeout before failing.
The actual wait time could be longer, particularly when multiple waits occur.

parameters.name: if_seq_no
parameters.description: Only perform the operation if the document has this sequence number.

parameters.name: if_primary_term
parameters.description: Only perform the operation if the document has this primary term.

parameters.name: require_alias
parameters.description: If true, the destination must be an index alias.

post.description:
Performs an update on every document in the index without changing the source,
for example to pick up a mapping change.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams or indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

parameters.name: analyzer
parameters.description: Analyzer to use for the query string.

parameters.name: analyze_wildcard
parameters.description: If `true`, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.

parameters.name: default_operator
parameters.description: The default operator for query string query: `AND` or `OR`.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Starting offset (default: 0)

parameters.name: ignore_unavailable
parameters.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

parameters.name: allow_no_indices
parameters.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

parameters.name: conflicts
parameters.description: What to do if update by query hits version conflicts: `abort` or `proceed`.

parameters.name: expand_wildcards
parameters.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

parameters.name: lenient
parameters.description: If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.

parameters.name: pipeline
parameters.description:
ID of the pipeline to use to preprocess incoming documents.
If the index has a default ingest pipeline specified, then setting the value to `_none` disables the default ingest pipeline for this request.
If a final pipeline is configured it will always run, regardless of the value of this parameter.

parameters.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Period each update request waits for the following operations: dynamic mapping updates, waiting for active shards.

parameters.name: wait_for_active_shards
parameters.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

parameters.name: scroll_size
parameters.description: Size of the scroll request that powers the operation.

parameters.name: wait_for_completion
parameters.description: If `true`, the request blocks until the operation is complete.

parameters.name: requests_per_second
parameters.description: The throttle for this request in sub-requests per second.

parameters.name: slices
parameters.description: The number of slices this task should be divided into.

schema.description: The operation definition and data (action-data pairs), separated by newlines
Comma-separated list of scroll IDs to clear if none was specified via the scroll_id parameter
Query to restrict the results specified with the Query DSL (optional)
The document
The query definition using the Query DSL
An index filter specified with the Query DSL
The document

docs.description: The documents you want to retrieve. Required if no index is specified in the request URI.

schema.description: Document identifiers; can be either `docs` (containing full document information) or `ids` (when index is provided in the URL.
The request definitions (metadata-search request definition pairs), separated by newlines
The request definitions (metadata-search request definition pairs), separated by newlines

docs.description: Array of existing or artificial documents.

ids.description: Simplified syntax to specify documents by their ID if they're in the same index.

schema.description: Define ids, documents, parameters or a list of parameters per document here. You must at least provide a list of document ids. See documentation.
The document

requests.description: A set of typical search requests, together with their provided ratings.

schema.description: The ranking evaluation search definition, including search requests, document ratings and ranking metric definition.

params.description:
Key-value pairs used to replace Mustache variables in the template.
The key is the variable name.
The value is the variable value.

source.description:
An inline search template.
Supports the same parameters as the search API's request body.
These parameters also support Mustache variables.
If no `id` or `<templated-id>` is specified, this parameter is required.

schema.description: The search definition template and its params

context.description: The context that the script should run in.

schema.description: The script to execute
The scroll ID if not passed by URL or query parameter.

aggregations.description: Defines the aggregations that are run as part of the search request.

explain.description: If true, returns detailed information about score computation as part of a hit.

ext.description: Configuration of search extensions defined by Opensearch plugins.

from.description:
Starting document offset.
Needs to be non-negative.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

indices_boost.description: Boosts the _score of documents from specified indices.

docvalue_fields.description:
Array of wildcard (`*`) patterns.
The request returns doc values for field names matching these patterns in the `hits.fields` property of the response.

knn.description: Defines the approximate kNN search to run.

min_score.description:
Minimum `_score` for matching documents.
Documents with a lower `_score` are not included in the search results.

profile.description:
Set to `true` to return detailed timing information about the execution of individual components in a search request.
NOTE: This is a debugging tool and adds significant overhead to search execution.

rescore.description: Can be used to improve precision by reordering just the top (for example 100 - 500) documents returned by the `query` and `post_filter` phases.

script_fields.description: Retrieve a script evaluation (based on different fields) for each hit.

size.description:
The number of hits to return.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

fields.description:
Array of wildcard (`*`) patterns.
The request returns values for field names matching these patterns in the `hits.fields` property of the response.

terminate_after.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Opensearch terminates the query early.
Opensearch collects documents before sorting.
Use with caution.
Opensearch applies this parameter to each shard handling the request.
When possible, let Opensearch perform early termination automatically.
Avoid specifying this parameter for requests that target data streams with backing indices across multiple data tiers.
If set to `0` (default), the query does not terminate early.

timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time to wait for a response from each shard.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
Defaults to no timeout.

track_scores.description: If true, calculate and return document scores, even if the scores are not used for sorting.

version.description: If true, returns document version as part of a hit.

seq_no_primary_term.description: If `true`, returns sequence number and primary term of the last modification of each hit.

stats.description:
Stats groups to associate with the search.
Each group maintains a statistics aggregation for its associated searches.
You can retrieve these stats using the indices stats API.

schema.description: The search definition using the Query DSL

explain.description: If `true`, returns detailed information about score calculation as part of each hit.

params.description:
Key-value pairs used to replace Mustache variables in the template.
The key is the variable name.
The value is the variable value.

profile.description: If `true`, the query execution is profiled.

source.description:
An inline search template. Supports the same parameters as the search API's
request body. Also supports Mustache variables. If no id is specified, this
parameter is required.

schema.description: The search definition template and its params

doc.description: An artificial document (a document not present in the index) for which you want to retrieve term vectors.

schema.description: Define parameters and or supply a document to get termvectors for. See documentation.

max_docs.description: The maximum number of documents to reindex.

schema.description: The search definition using the Query DSL and the prototype for the index request.
The point-in-time ids to be deleted

max_docs.description: The maximum number of documents to delete.

schema.description: The search definition using the Query DSL

detect_noop.description:
Set to false to disable setting 'result' in the response
to 'noop' if no change to the document occurred.

doc.description: A partial update to an existing document.

doc_as_upsert.description: Set to true to use the contents of 'doc' as the value of 'upsert'

scripted_upsert.description: Set to true to execute the script whether or not the document exists.

upsert.description:
If the document does not already exist, the contents of 'upsert' are inserted as a
new document. If the document exists, the 'script' is executed.

schema.description: The request definition requires either `script` or partial `doc`

max_docs.description: The maximum number of documents to update.

schema.description: The search definition using the Query DSL

metric_score.description: The overall evaluation quality calculated by the defined metric

details.description: The details section contains one entry for every query in the original requests section, keyed by the search request id

bulk#index.name: index
bulk#index.description: Name of the data stream, index, or index alias to perform bulk actions on.

bulk#pipeline.name: pipeline
bulk#pipeline.description:
ID of the pipeline to use to preprocess incoming documents.
If the index has a default ingest pipeline specified, then setting the value to `_none` disables the default ingest pipeline for this request.
If a final pipeline is configured it will always run, regardless of the value of this parameter.

bulk#refresh.name: refresh
bulk#refresh.description:
If `true`, Opensearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` do nothing with refreshes.
Valid values: `true`, `false`, `wait_for`.

bulk#routing.name: routing
bulk#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

bulk#_source.name: _source
bulk#_source.description: `true` or `false` to return the `_source` field or not, or a list of fields to return.

bulk#_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
bulk#_source_excludes.description: A comma-separated list of source fields to exclude from the response.

bulk#_source_includes.name: _source_includes
bulk#_source_includes.description: A comma-separated list of source fields to include in the response.

bulk#timeout.name: timeout
bulk#timeout.description: Period each action waits for the following operations: automatic index creation, dynamic mapping updates, waiting for active shards.

bulk#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
bulk#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to all or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

bulk#require_alias.name: require_alias
bulk#require_alias.description: If `true`, the requestâ€™s actions must target an index alias.

clear_scroll#scroll_id.name: scroll_id
clear_scroll#scroll_id.description:
Comma-separated list of scroll IDs to clear.
To clear all scroll IDs, use `_all`.

count#index.name: index
count#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

count#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
count#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

count#analyzer.name: analyzer
count#analyzer.description:
Analyzer to use for the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

count#analyze_wildcard.name: analyze_wildcard
count#analyze_wildcard.description:
If `true`, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

count#default_operator.name: default_operator
count#default_operator.description:
The default operator for query string query: `AND` or `OR`.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

count#df.name: df
count#df.description:
Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

count#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
count#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

count#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
count#ignore_throttled.description: If `true`, concrete, expanded or aliased indices are ignored when frozen.

count#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
count#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

count#lenient.name: lenient
count#lenient.description: If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.

count#min_score.name: min_score
count#min_score.description: Sets the minimum `_score` value that documents must have to be included in the result.

count#preference.name: preference
count#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

count#routing.name: routing
count#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

count#terminate_after.name: terminate_after
count#terminate_after.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Opensearch terminates the query early.
Opensearch collects documents before sorting.

count#q.name: q
count#q.description: Query in the Lucene query string syntax.

create#index.name: index
create#index.description:
Name of the data stream or index to target.
If the target doesnâ€™t exist and matches the name or wildcard (`*`) pattern of an index template with a `data_stream` definition, this request creates the data stream.
If the target doesnâ€™t exist and doesnâ€™t match a data stream template, this request creates the index.

create#pipeline.name: pipeline
create#pipeline.description:
ID of the pipeline to use to preprocess incoming documents.
If the index has a default ingest pipeline specified, then setting the value to `_none` disables the default ingest pipeline for this request.
If a final pipeline is configured it will always run, regardless of the value of this parameter.

create#refresh.name: refresh
create#refresh.description:
If `true`, Opensearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` do nothing with refreshes.
Valid values: `true`, `false`, `wait_for`.

create#routing.name: routing
create#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

create#timeout.name: timeout
create#timeout.description: Period the request waits for the following operations: automatic index creation, dynamic mapping updates, waiting for active shards.

create#version.name: version
create#version.description:
Explicit version number for concurrency control.
The specified version must match the current version of the document for the request to succeed.

create#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
create#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

explain#index.name: index
explain#index.description:
Index names used to limit the request.
Only a single index name can be provided to this parameter.

explain#analyzer.name: analyzer
explain#analyzer.description:
Analyzer to use for the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

explain#analyze_wildcard.name: analyze_wildcard
explain#analyze_wildcard.description: If `true`, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.

explain#default_operator.name: default_operator
explain#default_operator.description: The default operator for query string query: `AND` or `OR`.

explain#df.name: df
explain#df.description: Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.

explain#lenient.name: lenient
explain#lenient.description: If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.

explain#preference.name: preference
explain#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

explain#routing.name: routing
explain#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

explain#_source.name: _source
explain#_source.description: True or false to return the `_source` field or not, or a list of fields to return.

explain#_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
explain#_source_excludes.description: A comma-separated list of source fields to exclude from the response.

explain#_source_includes.name: _source_includes
explain#_source_includes.description: A comma-separated list of source fields to include in the response.

explain#stored_fields.name: stored_fields
explain#stored_fields.description: A comma-separated list of stored fields to return in the response.

explain#q.name: q
explain#q.description: Query in the Lucene query string syntax.

field_caps#index.name: index
field_caps#index.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request. Supports wildcards (*). To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use * or _all.

field_caps#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
field_caps#allow_no_indices.description:
If false, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias,
or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For example, a request
targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with foo but no index starts with bar.

field_caps#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
field_caps#expand_wildcards.description: Type of index that wildcard patterns can match. If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams. Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

field_caps#fields.name: fields
field_caps#fields.description: Comma-separated list of fields to retrieve capabilities for. Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.

field_caps#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
field_caps#ignore_unavailable.description: If `true`, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

field_caps#include_unmapped.name: include_unmapped
field_caps#include_unmapped.description: If true, unmapped fields are included in the response.

index#index.name: index
index#index.description: Name of the data stream or index to target.

index#if_primary_term.name: if_primary_term
index#if_primary_term.description: Only perform the operation if the document has this primary term.

index#if_seq_no.name: if_seq_no
index#if_seq_no.description: Only perform the operation if the document has this sequence number.

index#op_type.name: op_type
index#op_type.description:
Set to create to only index the document if it does not already exist (put if absent).
If a document with the specified `_id` already exists, the indexing operation will fail.
Same as using the `<index>/_create` endpoint.
Valid values: `index`, `create`.
If document id is specified, it defaults to `index`.
Otherwise, it defaults to `create`.

index#pipeline.name: pipeline
index#pipeline.description:
ID of the pipeline to use to preprocess incoming documents.
If the index has a default ingest pipeline specified, then setting the value to `_none` disables the default ingest pipeline for this request.
If a final pipeline is configured it will always run, regardless of the value of this parameter.

index#refresh.name: refresh
index#refresh.description:
If `true`, Opensearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` do nothing with refreshes.
Valid values: `true`, `false`, `wait_for`.

index#routing.name: routing
index#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

index#timeout.name: timeout
index#timeout.description: Period the request waits for the following operations: automatic index creation, dynamic mapping updates, waiting for active shards.

index#version.name: version
index#version.description:
Explicit version number for concurrency control.
The specified version must match the current version of the document for the request to succeed.

index#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
index#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to all or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

index#require_alias.name: require_alias
index#require_alias.description: If `true`, the destination must be an index alias.

mget#index.name: index
mget#index.description: Name of the index to retrieve documents from when `ids` are specified, or when a document in the `docs` array does not specify an index.

mget#preference.name: preference
mget#preference.description: Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on. Random by default.

mget#realtime.name: realtime
mget#realtime.description: If `true`, the request is real-time as opposed to near-real-time.

mget#refresh.name: refresh
mget#refresh.description: If `true`, the request refreshes relevant shards before retrieving documents.

mget#routing.name: routing
mget#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

mget#_source.name: _source
mget#_source.description: True or false to return the `_source` field or not, or a list of fields to return.

mget#_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
mget#_source_excludes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to exclude from the response.
You can also use this parameter to exclude fields from the subset specified in `_source_includes` query parameter.

mget#_source_includes.name: _source_includes
mget#_source_includes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to include in the response.
If this parameter is specified, only these source fields are returned. You can exclude fields from this subset using the `_source_excludes` query parameter.
If the `_source` parameter is `false`, this parameter is ignored.

mget#stored_fields.name: stored_fields
mget#stored_fields.description: If `true`, retrieves the document fields stored in the index rather than the document `_source`.

msearch#index.name: index
msearch#index.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases to search.

msearch#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
msearch#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If true, network roundtrips between the coordinating node and remote clusters are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

msearch#max_concurrent_searches.name: max_concurrent_searches
msearch#max_concurrent_searches.description: Maximum number of concurrent searches the multi search API can execute.

msearch#max_concurrent_shard_requests.name: max_concurrent_shard_requests
msearch#max_concurrent_shard_requests.description: Maximum number of concurrent shard requests that each sub-search request executes per node.

msearch#pre_filter_shard_size.name: pre_filter_shard_size
msearch#pre_filter_shard_size.description: Defines a threshold that enforces a pre-filter roundtrip to prefilter search shards based on query rewriting if the number of shards the search request expands to exceeds the threshold. This filter roundtrip can limit the number of shards significantly if for instance a shard can not match any documents based on its rewrite method i.e., if date filters are mandatory to match but the shard bounds and the query are disjoint.

msearch#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
msearch#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, hits.total are returned as an integer in the response. Defaults to false, which returns an object.

msearch#search_type.name: search_type
msearch#search_type.description: Indicates whether global term and document frequencies should be used when scoring returned documents.

msearch#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
msearch#typed_keys.description: Specifies whether aggregation and suggester names should be prefixed by their respective types in the response.

msearch_template#index.name: index
msearch_template#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*`.

msearch_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
msearch_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If `true`, network round-trips are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

msearch_template#max_concurrent_searches.name: max_concurrent_searches
msearch_template#max_concurrent_searches.description: Maximum number of concurrent searches the API can run.

msearch_template#search_type.name: search_type
msearch_template#search_type.description:
The type of the search operation.
Available options: `query_then_fetch`, `dfs_query_then_fetch`.

msearch_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
msearch_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.description:
If `true`, the response returns `hits.total` as an integer.
If `false`, it returns `hits.total` as an object.

msearch_template#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
msearch_template#typed_keys.description: If `true`, the response prefixes aggregation and suggester names with their respective types.

mtermvectors#index.name: index
mtermvectors#index.description: Name of the index that contains the documents.

mtermvectors#ids.name: ids
mtermvectors#ids.description: A comma-separated list of documents ids. You must define ids as parameter or set "ids" or "docs" in the request body

mtermvectors#fields.name: fields
mtermvectors#fields.description:
Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in the statistics.
Used as the default list unless a specific field list is provided in the `completion_fields` or `fielddata_fields` parameters.

mtermvectors#field_statistics.name: field_statistics
mtermvectors#field_statistics.description: If `true`, the response includes the document count, sum of document frequencies, and sum of total term frequencies.

mtermvectors#offsets.name: offsets
mtermvectors#offsets.description: If `true`, the response includes term offsets.

mtermvectors#payloads.name: payloads
mtermvectors#payloads.description: If `true`, the response includes term payloads.

mtermvectors#positions.name: positions
mtermvectors#positions.description: If `true`, the response includes term positions.

mtermvectors#preference.name: preference
mtermvectors#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

mtermvectors#realtime.name: realtime
mtermvectors#realtime.description: If true, the request is real-time as opposed to near-real-time.

mtermvectors#routing.name: routing
mtermvectors#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

mtermvectors#term_statistics.name: term_statistics
mtermvectors#term_statistics.description: If true, the response includes term frequency and document frequency.

mtermvectors#version.name: version
mtermvectors#version.description: If `true`, returns the document version as part of a hit.

put_script#id.name: id
put_script#id.description:
Identifier for the stored script or search template.
Must be unique within the cluster.

put_script#context.name: context
put_script#context.description:
Context in which the script or search template should run.
To prevent errors, the API immediately compiles the script or template in this context.

put_script#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
put_script#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
put_script#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

put_script#timeout.name: timeout
put_script#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

rank_eval#index.name: index
rank_eval#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request. Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.
To target all data streams and indices in a cluster, omit this parameter or use `_all` or `*`.

rank_eval#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
rank_eval#allow_no_indices.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

rank_eval#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
rank_eval#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

rank_eval#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
rank_eval#ignore_unavailable.description: If `true`, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

render_search_template#id.name: id
render_search_template#id.description:
ID of the search template to render.
If no `source` is specified, this or the `id` request body parameter is required.

scroll#scroll.name: scroll
scroll#scroll.description: Period to retain the search context for scrolling.

scroll#scroll_id_.name: scroll_id
scroll#scroll_id_.description: The scroll ID for scrolled search

scroll#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
scroll#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, the API responseâ€™s hit.total property is returned as an integer. If false, the API responseâ€™s hit.total property is returned as an object.

search#index.name: index
search#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

search#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search#allow_partial_search_results.name: allow_partial_search_results
search#allow_partial_search_results.description: If true, returns partial results if there are shard request timeouts or shard failures. If false, returns an error with no partial results.

search#analyzer.name: analyzer
search#analyzer.description:
Analyzer to use for the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the q query string parameter is specified.

search#analyze_wildcard.name: analyze_wildcard
search#analyze_wildcard.description:
If true, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.
This parameter can only be used when the q query string parameter is specified.

search#batched_reduce_size.name: batched_reduce_size
search#batched_reduce_size.description:
The number of shard results that should be reduced at once on the coordinating node.
This value should be used as a protection mechanism to reduce the memory overhead per search request if the potential number of shards in the request can be large.

search#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
search#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If true, network round-trips between the coordinating node and the remote clusters are minimized when executing cross-cluster search (CCS) requests.

search#default_operator.name: default_operator
search#default_operator.description:
The default operator for query string query: AND or OR.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search#df.name: df
search#df.description:
Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the q query string parameter is specified.

search#docvalue_fields.name: docvalue_fields
search#docvalue_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return as the docvalue representation for each hit.

search#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

search#explain.name: explain
search#explain.description: If `true`, returns detailed information about score computation as part of a hit.

search#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
search#ignore_throttled.description: If `true`, concrete, expanded or aliased indices will be ignored when frozen.

search#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search#lenient.name: lenient
search#lenient.description:
If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search#max_concurrent_shard_requests.name: max_concurrent_shard_requests
search#max_concurrent_shard_requests.description:
Defines the number of concurrent shard requests per node this search executes concurrently.
This value should be used to limit the impact of the search on the cluster in order to limit the number of concurrent shard requests.

search#preference.name: preference

search#pre_filter_shard_size.name: pre_filter_shard_size

search#request_cache.name: request_cache
search#request_cache.description:
If `true`, the caching of search results is enabled for requests where `size` is `0`.
Defaults to index level settings.

search#routing.name: routing
search#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

search#scroll.name: scroll
search#scroll.description:
Period to retain the search context for scrolling. See Scroll search results.
By default, this value cannot exceed `1d` (24 hours).
You can change this limit using the `search.max_keep_alive` cluster-level setting.

search#search_type.name: search_type
search#search_type.description: How distributed term frequencies are calculated for relevance scoring.

search#stats.name: stats
search#stats.description: Specific `tag` of the request for logging and statistical purposes.

search#stored_fields.name: stored_fields
search#stored_fields.description:
A comma-separated list of stored fields to return as part of a hit.
If no fields are specified, no stored fields are included in the response.
If this field is specified, the `_source` parameter defaults to `false`.
You can pass `_source: true` to return both source fields and stored fields in the search response.

search#suggest_field.name: suggest_field
search#suggest_field.description: Specifies which field to use for suggestions.

search#suggest_mode.name: suggest_mode
search#suggest_mode.description:
Specifies the suggest mode.
This parameter can only be used when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search#suggest_size.name: suggest_size
search#suggest_size.description:
Number of suggestions to return.
This parameter can only be used when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search#suggest_text.name: suggest_text
search#suggest_text.description:
The source text for which the suggestions should be returned.
This parameter can only be used when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search#terminate_after.name: terminate_after
search#terminate_after.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Opensearch terminates the query early.
Opensearch collects documents before sorting.
Use with caution.
Opensearch applies this parameter to each shard handling the request.
When possible, let Opensearch perform early termination automatically.
Avoid specifying this parameter for requests that target data streams with backing indices across multiple data tiers.
If set to `0` (default), the query does not terminate early.

search#timeout.name: timeout
search#timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time to wait for a response from each shard.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

search#track_total_hits.name: track_total_hits
search#track_total_hits.description:
Number of hits matching the query to count accurately.
If `true`, the exact number of hits is returned at the cost of some performance.
If `false`, the response does not include the total number of hits matching the query.

search#track_scores.name: track_scores
search#track_scores.description: If `true`, calculate and return document scores, even if the scores are not used for sorting.

search#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search#typed_keys.description: If `true`, aggregation and suggester names are be prefixed by their respective types in the response.

search#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
search#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: Indicates whether `hits.total` should be rendered as an integer or an object in the rest search response.

search#version.name: version
search#version.description: If `true`, returns document version as part of a hit.

search#_source.name: _source

search#_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
search#_source_excludes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to exclude from the response.
You can also use this parameter to exclude fields from the subset specified in `_source_includes` query parameter.
If the `_source` parameter is `false`, this parameter is ignored.

search#_source_includes.name: _source_includes
search#_source_includes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to include in the response.
If this parameter is specified, only these source fields are returned.
You can exclude fields from this subset using the `_source_excludes` query parameter.
If the `_source` parameter is `false`, this parameter is ignored.

search#seq_no_primary_term.name: seq_no_primary_term
search#seq_no_primary_term.description: If `true`, returns sequence number and primary term of the last modification of each hit.

search#q.name: q
search#q.description:
Query in the Lucene query string syntax using query parameter search.
Query parameter searches do not support the full Opensearch Query DSL but are handy for testing.

search#size.name: size
search#size.description:
Defines the number of hits to return.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

search#from.name: from
search#from.description:
Starting document offset.
Needs to be non-negative.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

search_shards#index.name: index
search_shards#index.description: Returns the indices and shards that a search request would be executed against.

search_shards#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search_shards#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search_shards#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search_shards#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

search_shards#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search_shards#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search_shards#local.name: local
search_shards#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

search_shards#preference.name: preference
search_shards#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

search_shards#routing.name: routing
search_shards#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

search_template#index.name: index
search_template#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices,
and aliases to search. Supports wildcards (*).

search_template#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search_template#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
search_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If `true`, network round-trips are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

search_template#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search_template#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

search_template#explain.name: explain
search_template#explain.description: If `true`, the response includes additional details about score computation as part of a hit.

search_template#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
search_template#ignore_throttled.description: If `true`, specified concrete, expanded, or aliased indices are not included in the response when throttled.

search_template#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search_template#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search_template#preference.name: preference
search_template#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

search_template#profile.name: profile
search_template#profile.description: If `true`, the query execution is profiled.

search_template#routing.name: routing
search_template#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

search_template#scroll.name: scroll
search_template#scroll.description:
Specifies how long a consistent view of the index
should be maintained for scrolled search.

search_template#search_type.name: search_type
search_template#search_type.description: The type of the search operation.

search_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
search_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, hits.total are rendered as an integer in the response.

search_template#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search_template#typed_keys.description: If `true`, the response prefixes aggregation and suggester names with their respective types.

termvectors#index.name: index
termvectors#index.description: Name of the index that contains the document.

termvectors#fields.name: fields
termvectors#fields.description:
Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in the statistics.
Used as the default list unless a specific field list is provided in the `completion_fields` or `fielddata_fields` parameters.

termvectors#field_statistics.name: field_statistics
termvectors#field_statistics.description: If `true`, the response includes the document count, sum of document frequencies, and sum of total term frequencies.

termvectors#offsets.name: offsets
termvectors#offsets.description: If `true`, the response includes term offsets.

termvectors#payloads.name: payloads
termvectors#payloads.description: If `true`, the response includes term payloads.

termvectors#positions.name: positions
termvectors#positions.description: If `true`, the response includes term positions.

termvectors#preference.name: preference
termvectors#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

termvectors#realtime.name: realtime
termvectors#realtime.description: If true, the request is real-time as opposed to near-real-time.

termvectors#routing.name: routing
termvectors#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

termvectors#term_statistics.name: term_statistics
termvectors#term_statistics.description: If `true`, the response includes term frequency and document frequency.

termvectors#version.name: version
termvectors#version.description: If `true`, returns the document version as part of a hit.
